{"step_by_step_thinking": "An obstinate cry is usually associated with stubbornness or resistance, not a coping mechanism to unpleasant stimuli. A hurt cry is a response to physical pain, not necessarily a coping mechanism. A frightened cry is a response to fear or danger, not a coping mechanism. A compensatory cry, by definition, is a type of cry that serves as a coping mechanism to deal with unpleasant stimuli.", "answer_choice": "C"}
